poem:
Inexplicable Madness

I read of plans that brewed in shadows,
a mind so twisted it bends the light.
Holly Willoughby wakes to a different morning,
where her name is a thread in a web of fear.
We dress ourselves in old normalities,
while somewhere, pure malevolence 
is exiled in stone, but never far enough.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Holly Willoughby: man jailed for life over kidnap, rape and murder plot A former security guard obsessed with Holly Willoughby has been sentenced to life with a minimum term of 16 years for masterminding a plot to kidnap, rape and murder the TV presenter. Gavin Plumb, 37, carefully planned a “home invasion” at Willoughby’s property where he planned to tie her up and rape her in front of her family before murdering her and disposing". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
